t: Psalm 147
Praise*pn the Lord.*s How*pn good it is to sing praises to our God, how*ld pleasant and fitting to praise him!
The*pn Lord*s builds up Jerusalem; he*ld gathers the exiles of Israel.
He*ln heals the brokenhearted and*ld binds up their wounds.
He*ln determines the number of the stars and*ld calls them each by name.
Great*ln is our Lord and mighty in power; his*ld understanding has no limit.
The*ln Lord*s sustains the humble but*ld casts the wicked to the ground.
Sing*pn to the Lord*s with grateful praise; make*ld music to our God on the harp.
He*pn covers the sky with clouds; he*ld supplies the earth with rain and*ld makes grass grow on the hills.
He*ln provides food for the cattle and*ld for the young ravens when they call.
His*pn pleasure is not in the strength of the horse, nor*ld his delight in the legs of the warrior;
the*ln Lord*s delights in those who fear him, who*ld put their hope in his unfailing love.
Extol*pn the Lord,*s Jerusalem; praise*ld your God, Zion.
He*pn strengthens the bars of your gates and*ld blesses your people within you.
He*ln grants peace to your borders and*ld satisfies you with the finest of wheat.
He*pn sends his command to the earth; his*ld word runs swiftly.
He*ln spreads the snow like wool and*ld scatters the frost like ashes.
He*ln hurls down his hail like pebbles. Who*ld can withstand his icy blast?
He*ln sends his word and melts them; he*ld stirs up his breezes, and the waters flow.
He*pn has revealed his word to Jacob, his*ld laws and decrees to Israel.
He*ln has done this for no other nation; they*ld do not know his laws. Praise*pn the Lord.*s
